question.text: Find out the incorrect statement from the following.

options.text: Dark reaction depends on the product formed by light reaction.

In stroma, enzymatic reactions incorporates  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  into the plant leading to the synthesis of sugar.
Purple and green sulphur bacteria use H2 S as hydrogen donor.
There is no division of labour in chloroplast.

solution.text: Division of labour occurs in the chloroplast. In grana, light reaction occurs in which ATP and NADPH + H are synthesized, which are used in dark reaction to reduce carbon dioxide to glucose. All enzymes of the Calvin cycle are present in the stroma.
